title.label: Interesting game but device orientation lock causes my brain to melt

content.label: I want to play this game when I go to bed. I sleep on my side. But the game flips over and doesn‚Äôt respect iOS orientation lock. It‚Äôs a good game but this ruins the fun when you can‚Äôt play it sideways.

title.label: Rare Game with Non-Trivial Puzzles & Character

content.label:
Wonderful game.  Great way tonelagem procedure thinking too.  (I‚Äôve even assigned it as HW as a way to build familiarity with procedural thinking and implication.  Most programming tools just teach you commands and don‚Äôt help people develop thinking habits they need to program.)

Great game if you like logic puzzles and games with character.

title.label: Possibly the best five dollars I have ever spent

content.label:
-good puzzles addressing real fundamental programming tasks and logic
-compelling visual design, really smooth graphics and game dynamics
-recursive hilarity

I would much rather support these guys than buy that $7 latte.

Update:
Within 10 minutes of my last post I figured out that the sound ONLY works with wired headphones or Bluetooth speakers and headphones. Minor annoyance but livable.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
5/21/2020
Just downloaded and I was excited to play, but there‚Äôs no sound. I couldn‚Äôt find any settings menu within the game, and I made sure that my phone‚Äôs volume was on and working with music and other apps, and that Bluetooth was off. I‚Äôm using an iPhone XR.

This could be a one-off issue since I can‚Äôt find it referenced anywhere else online, but I do remember that the sequel, 7 Billion Humans, had the same issue on Steam. For 7 Billion Humans after a few days to a week the sound started working on that one, not sure why or how. Hopefully it‚Äôs the same scenario with Human Resource Machine on iOS, but this is just annoying, since you would think that including sound on a game wouldn‚Äôt be so complex.

This game challenges you more than it teaches you. It gives a task and doesn‚Äôt assist in the solution at all. If you‚Äôre wanting to learn programming for the first time, this game discourages you more than it assists your growth. It seems this game is for programmers that want small challenges.
This game is great but progress is not saved in phone backups. Every time I get a new phone I have to start over. It‚Äôs so annoying and I hate playing the same levels.
I was able to progress through the levels, but I still felt like I was at a low level the entire time.

title.label: he not busy being born is busy dying

content.label: I share the developers' cynicism. We are in a mindless bureaucratic march toward nothing. But if I'm going to waste my life staring at screens, solving meaningless puzzles that have already been solved by someone else and are solvable much more easily by computer programs that have already been built‚Äîif I am to be boxed in by machines that quantify my every move‚Äîit's at least nice when the pointless puzzles are challenging. So thanks. Maybe I should go outside and play now.

I made a script which multiplies two inputs, the way the level tells you to. The script gives the correct output, but the manager requests a zero on the last pair, regardless of what said pair is. I am stuck.

title.label: hey i like it so far but can i change the language?

content.label: I love the game itself. But i would love to change the language from the English to Korean a lot if possible. I bought this outside Korea.

They need to have locking screen orientation.  The minimal basic options are poor.  

The game itself is decent.  It‚Äôs polished and I appreciate the hard work designing a friendly debugger.  The optimizations are the main fun of the game, the levels and instructions themselves are reasonable.

Polish and design 5/5.  Basic quality of life features 3/5.  Puzzles and gameplay 4/5.  Price and platform implementation 3/5.  Story 4/5.

title.label: Fantastic game but unbelievable that save games are not backed up

content.label: I would give this game 8 stars if only it would allow me to continue my progress on a new phone. Instead I have to re-solve all of the challenge problems, which just kills my motivation to pick it back up. WHY doesn‚Äôt this sync to iCloud for saves, or at the very least why aren‚Äôt the save games included in my iTunes backup?

title.label: LET ME LAY ON MY SIDE

content.label: Lying on my side causes the game to rotate (even with rotation lock enabled in the control center).

I'm totally frustrated but delighted to be challenged, so I send this message to the developers with a grin: F-you, you evil, sadistic, geniuses! Well done!
This kind of logical, linear thinking makes my brain sweat. How awesome that playing can teach a new way of thinking -- kind of empowering, lots of fun. I can see how this can be applied to communication.

This game is pretty awesome, if I do say myself. Having prior knowledge to coding helped me with the first few levels, but had to look for help after a few levels. I recommend having a small amount of coding knowledge before playing so you won‚Äôt get completely stuck. And like the app says, because of it difficulty, it‚Äôs better if you play this ages 9 and over.

Soy outüå±

I was looking for a game that would help with coding. This game helps with some weird slantwise stuff that might help with logical thinking sometimes, but otherwise it‚Äôs no good. The way the screen is set up, it‚Äôs frustrating trying to look at your ‚Äúprogram‚Äù or make changes; I try scrolling and I‚Äôve selected something, now it‚Äôs out of place and I have to figure out where it came from before trying to scroll through the obnoxiously long line of code necessary because I can‚Äôt use normal if-then sorts of statements.
As a game, it‚Äôs mildly funny too, so that‚Äôs cool.
The game is great but please make it support iCloud sync between multiple iOS devices.

title.label: can‚Äôt listen to other audio when playing

content.label: my big complaint is that i can‚Äôt listen to apple music or audiobook while playing. sound is not needed for this game. i‚Äôd like to play the game and listen to what i want.

I am a non-coder that enjoys the idea of coding. This is a fantastic game.  Very hard to get the optimum score on each level (i.e., the most efficient / effective program) so even after you win there‚Äôs very often more to do if you choose to go for a gold standard.

title.label: Two years, one update, nothing new

content.label: This is a decent game to understand the procedural way machine language works as well as the most rudimentary programming. Sorely needs more levels and functions would be a great addition. But 2 years and the only update was for the new iPhone X line of phones. Very disappointed, so I updated my review from 4 to 2 stars.

title.label: Good game on iPad - rotation bugs plague iPhone

content.label:
This is an amazing game and spend the money if you will only play it on the iPad. 

If you try to use an iPhone, there‚Äôs an annoying bug where is nags you constantly to rotate away from landscape mode. 

Also, the support link has no support contact that I could read on the iPhone.  Lots of FAQ about steam but no iOS support from the support link. 

Bad on Apple for approving that metadata. I‚Äôll give the developer a pass and 5 stars since the app is good and maybe they didn‚Äôt realize their support link was supposed to help people get support.
It‚Äôs a fun game but please update for iPhone X support. I was surprised that this was recently highlighted by Apple but hasn‚Äôt been touched in years.
I hope no kids play this game because all it's going to teach them is how to write bad code. Also since when does putting a value in "output" erase it from your "hand"

I was very surprised at how much I like this game, didn‚Äôt think a game about basic programming would be this fun. Some of the levels are deceptively simple, and some are simply deceiving.... I don‚Äôt have any programming experience so it was a challenge to think in the way needed, I‚Äôm a visual person so I find that running through the programs while building them to see what should come next helps. The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is that it‚Äôs too short, there hasn‚Äôt been any updates to add levels and there isn‚Äôt a player-built level system to build and submit new levels. Also they could have added a more challenging set of programs to complete with higher level commands, at the very least new level packs should be added, I‚Äôd be more than happy to pay for new level packs as I imagine others would as well. Overall it‚Äôs a great game, and I really hope they expand on what they created.

The idea is good and the puzzles are fun. But...

The way it‚Äôs set up, once your code get longer, if your try to scroll you will often end up moving a jump or some other line of
Code, with no undo feature good luck with that.

It‚Äôs sad that battling with the just brain dead way they setup the UI for the code is the hardest part of this game and it should be a non-part.

In the end I give up fighting the UI.

This is one of my favorite games I‚Äôve ever played. It‚Äôs so clever and so fun, and is a real challenge. My only complaint is I wish there were more levels so I could play forever!

These same people also made a game called World of Goo, which I had blazed through before this game came around, so I knew  Human Resources Machine was going to be good before going in. These people can do no wrong.
Not optimized for iPhone X, don‚Äôt bother purchasing if you have the device.

title.label: PLEASE MAKE SCREEN STRETCH FOR IPHONE X

content.label: Just paid 5$ for a great game but doesn‚Äôt fit the screen on my phone :/

I love this on the PC and when I saw it on iOS I had to pick it up. 

Hope to see a sequel or new challenges in the future.

title.label: Can you add back up to iCloud?

content.label: Would like to share progress between iPhone and iPad. Otherwise great.

You cannot control the inputs during testing: random inputs are appropriate to test your final solution but for problem solving, inconsistent test inputs means the criteria that you just attempted to solve won‚Äôt immediately occur again - thus you have no way of knowing if you actually solved it. No one would ever write code like this.

Not.

Ever.

This game is great for puzzle lovers and is a good intro to code. I agree with others saying more feedback or hints would be useful in case people get stuck. It would also benefit from being able to copy and paste sections of code into other sections rather than the current all-or-nothing approach. Overall adorable and enjoyable to play.

I have seriously never, ever felt prouder to finish a game in my life!!! 
 Some levels felt like torture, yet I can‚Äôt help myself but to dive right back in to complete all the optimization challenges.
Can‚Äôt wait to see what these guys will come up with next.
Love this game! I keep checking back in to see if they‚Äôve released a new one but alas....
Can‚Äôt play and listen to podcast/Spotify simultaneously

I‚Äôve actually owned this game on Steam for a while, but never felt to much like playing it in the computer. This version is great to solve puzzles on the go. I‚Äôd recommend a stylus if you‚Äôre using a phone instead of a tablet though because stuff is fairly small.

The game itself starts simply and quickly gets challenging. Optional levels and optimization challenges also add extra difficulty for those who are geniuses. 

Overall it‚Äôs a good experience for the thinker. Worth $5 in my opinion.
I downloaded and played straight through all weekend, I‚Äôm straight addicted to this game.

this game is really cute. it's good for little kids and really makes learning how to code fun. basically you just program your little slaves to do your bidding, and like many other games by tomorrow corporation, it's dark humored but still manages to be cute and lovable. my one complaint is that a lot of the levels are WAY too hard, with not enough instruction. sometimes the instructions can be funny, (an example from the game: "if i have 6 apples, and you take 2 away, what do we have? yes, a workplace theft incident") but other than that it can be confusing and frustrating at times.
The fourth level is unbeatable

This game is for critical thinkers. This is not a puzzle game to waste idle time, it requires focus and analysis. If you‚Äôre looking for something to stroke your ego look elsewhere. Best puzzle game in the store in 2017, no doubt.
Guys please make it iPhone X compatible!!

As a coder, I love this concept of teaching how to build algorithms is brilliant.  As we move forward into a tech driven world, it is imperative to teach people the logic necessary to take part.  This is wonderfully fun and the boss characters are hilarious.  Couldn‚Äôt get any better (except add more puzzles).
Great game. I wish they added more puzzles.
This game was featured as the game of the day but it has no support for the iPhone X. The game is great and the idea is super original just please update it to support iPhone X. Thanks!
Paid $4.99 for the game and can‚Äôt get past the 2nd level because it‚Äôs freezes every time I try to use the ‚Äújump‚Äù function. Super annoying.

Human Resource Machine is a decent game, if you can actually call it a game. It basically just involves trying to put commands in the correct sequence to move things from A to B. It isn‚Äôt necessarily exciting (or fun), but the sequence puzzles provide more of a challenge as the game progresses.

That said, HRM doesn‚Äôt support iCloud to sync your progress, so you‚Äôre out of luck if you want to delete the game without losing your progress, or play on multiple devices. 

It is also disappointing that HRM lacks support for GameCentre, and doesn‚Äôt include any form of achievements.
Opened the app and guess I'm back at the beginning. It's a still a good game though.

title.label: Good game but it looses your status

content.label: I've started this game twice getting to floor 22. I've lost interest in starting a third time. Should sync via iOS games center and be playable across iPhone and iPad.

This game is amazing. Faintly cute and extremely clever and witty, this game is a mind-boosting treat. Though challenging, once you solve a puzzle, you feel so satisfied with yourself! I highly recommend this game.
I love this game. Instantly addicted. BUT, now that I got to the multiply level, I can't get a multiplier command to appear on the list. *edit* OMG. That's the puzzle. Well done.
